name: uneager
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not eager to do or have something: Most local residents are very uneager to have the area sold to developers. She stood patiently waiting for her turn with a calm, uneager face.
More examplesFewer examplesHe would not mind helping to create a real rival to the governing party, but is uneager to lead it.Lee herself was uneager to broach the subject, afraid of hurting Janice and being blamed by her.Some of the jurors listened like uneager 12-year-olds with their loud sighs and constant yawns.
